scenario_title: Insider Outsider Collusion for Ransomware and DDoS Distraction

why.details: Internal traitor bribes insiders to plant malware for the purpose of data theft and ransom, also using a DDoS attack as a cover.

how.description: Contacted internal personnel by email, offering large bribes to gain access to internal network permissions.
how.procedure: Adversary uses social engineering and bribery to recruit or co-opt an insider who holds sufficient privileges, by sending targeted email or messages promising reward for granting or enabling access.
observable_evidence: Internal emails offering payments or reward for permissions
Access requests initiated by non-standard insiders after contact
Suspicious correspondence between insider and external actor
how.impact: Compromised insider enables attacker to bypass primary controls and gain privileged access.

how.description: Insider or colluding actor installed malware script on internal network to collect and exfiltrate sensitive data.
how.procedure: Using access obtained from step 1, malware is planted (script, loader) on the network or host, scheduled or configured for autostart, to enable automated data collection or preparation for exfiltration.
observable_evidence: Malicious script or executable placed in system startup folders
Unexpected scheduled task or service created by insider account
New process running with elevated rights loaded by unknown binary
how.impact: Malware installation establishes foothold for large-scale data theft or later attack phases.

how.description: Sent phishing email with malicious link/attachment to other administrators to propagate backdoor and extend system access.
how.procedure: Actor uses malicious email to lure additional privileged users into clicking link or opening attachment that grants backdoor access, thereby compromising further systems and enabling broader network intrusion.
observable_evidence: Phishing email sent from internal account to admin recipients
Unexpected PowerShell or script execution by administrator account
New established remote sessions from host compromised via backdoor
how.impact: Expansion of control and access across multiple privileged systems increases blast radius and opens exfiltration paths.

how.description: Launched DDoS attack against company servers to distract security teams while data-exfiltration malware operated in the background.
how.procedure: Attackers generate denial-of-service traffic or other mass disruption to consume security resources and reduce detection focus, creating opportunity window for stealth data theft.
observable_evidence: High volume inbound traffic causing server overload or service degradation
Simultaneous large file export or exfiltration activity during DDoS event
Alert fatigue or delayed detection correlated with disruption event
how.impact: Security distraction increases chance of undetected data loss and extends time adversary can operate unobserved.
